description:
This is a market on the number of people in The United States of America who have received at least one 'booster shot' of an approved COVID-19 vaccine, according to the CDC COVID tracker, by the resolution date, November 10, 2021, 9:00 PM ET. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if 30,000,000 or more people received a booster dose by the resolution date, and "No" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the official data published by the CDC available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccinations_vacc-total-admin-rate-total, in the box with the text "People received a booster dose," and will be checked daily until the resolution time/date. If the website is down at the final check, the most recently available data will be used to resolve the market. If the website is not down, this market will resolve according to the data as available immediately at the time of resolution, and resolution will not be delayed for the purpose of waiting for updated data from a specific date. 

-----------------------------------------

COVID Data Tracker counts people as "Fully Vaccinated with a Booster Dose" if they are fully vaccinated and have received another dose of the COVID-19 vaccine since August 13, 2021. This includes people who received booster doses and people who received additional doses.

COVID Data Tracker counts people as being “Fully Vaccinated” if they received two doses on different days (regardless of time interval) of the two-dose mRNA series or received one dose of a single-dose vaccine.

Resolution Source: https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccinations_vacc-total-admin-rate-total

markets.question: Will 30 million Americans have received at least one 'booster shot' of the COVID-19 vaccine by November 10th?

title: Will 30 million Americans have received at least one 'booster shot' of the COVID-19 vaccine by November 10th?
